example-server.server_description: Description of what this MCP server provides (helps AI decide when to use it)
example-server.notes: Optional: Leave allowed_tools empty or remove it to use all tools from this server

context7.server_description: Context7 MCP server - provides documentation and knowledge lookup for various frameworks and libraries
context7.notes: Public test server - no auth required. Good for testing MCP integration.

_comments.server_url: REQUIRED. HTTPS URL to the MCP server endpoint. Must be publicly accessible by OpenAI's API.
_comments.server_description: OPTIONAL but recommended. Helps OpenAI understand when to use this server's tools. Be descriptive about the domain and capabilities.
_comments.authorization: OPTIONAL. OAuth access token or API key. Format: 'Bearer TOKEN' or just 'TOKEN' depending on server requirements. Leave empty string if no auth required.
_comments.require_approval: OPTIONAL. Default: 'never'. Options: 'never' (auto-approve all tool calls), 'always' (require approval for every call), or object with per-tool rules. NOTE: Only 'never' is currently supported - approval UI is a future feature.
_comments.allowed_tools: OPTIONAL. Array of tool names to whitelist. If empty or omitted, all tools from the server are available. Use this to limit which tools the AI can access.
_comments.notes: OPTIONAL. This field is ignored by the bot - use it for your own documentation.
_comments.security_note: IMPORTANT: This file is in .gitignore to prevent accidental commits of API keys. Never commit secrets to version control.
_comments.finding_servers: See https://modelcontextprotocol.io/servers for a directory of available MCP servers.
_comments.transport_note: This bot uses OpenAI's native MCP support, which only works with remote MCP servers over HTTPS (Streamable HTTP or HTTP/SSE transport). Local stdio-based MCP servers (npx commands) are not supported.
